title: Ticket #6483: Improve logging when a daemon gets a fatal signal
description:
The signal handler installed for fatal signals in daemoncore can do a much better job of logging information that would be helpful in diagnosing a crash. The following improvements should be made:

  • Log the signal number.
  • Use the enhanced signal handler that receives a siginfo_t, and log data from that struct.
  • Use dprintf()'s async-safe log-writing function for all logging in the signal handler.
  • Always install the signal handler on unix, not just when the Google coredumper is present.
